name: Bonsai
headline: The all-in-one solution for small businesses and self-employed.
description:
Founded with the purpose of empowering anyone to work for themselves, Bonsai is the trusted back-office software solution for 500,000+ small businesses and self-employed around the world.

Bonsai helps individuals and teams manage their clients, deliver great work, get paid on time and track finances - all in the same place and integrated together to make running a business as seamless as possible.

founders.name: Matt Nish, Founder
founders.description: Matt Nish is the co-founder and Head of Design at Bonsai, which he started with Matt Brown and Redon Gjika in San Francisco, California.  Matt has led the user experience and app design from the beginning, leveraging his former freelancing and agency work experience as inspiration.

generated_description:
Bonsai is an all-in-one software platform aimed at simplifying the operations of independent professionals and small businesses. Founded in 2016 as part of Y Combinator's W16 batch, it now supports over 500,000 businesses in managing client relations, project management, and financial tasks, all from a single, intuitive interface.

The goal of Bonsai is straightforward: to empower individuals to work for themselves while easing the back-office load that often comes with being self-employed. By consolidating tools for client management (like CRM, proposals, and contracts), project management (such as time tracking and task management), and financial oversight (including invoicing and budgeting), Bonsai creates a seamless workflow that saves users time and stress.

Located in Boulder, Colorado, Bonsai has a team of 25 passionate employees, guided by their group partner Michael Seibel. The software is tagged as 'documents' and 'SaaS', indicating its focus on providing digital solutions tailored for productivity.

Key features of Bonsai include:

- **Client Management**: Tools for CRM, proposals, contracts, and scheduling to streamline client interactions.
- **Project Management**: Capabilities for time tracking, task management, collaboration, and resource management to ensure projects stay on track and within budget.
- **Financial Management**: Features for budgeting, invoicing, report generation, managing expenses, and processing payments to keep finances organized.

Bonsai emphasizes flexibility and scalability, serving a diverse range of industries from consulting firms and marketing agencies to creative studios and architecture firms. Its user-friendly templates for contracts, proposals, and invoices are designed to foster clear communication and professional presentation, catering to specific professional needs.

If you're interested in learning more or trying it out, Bonsai offers a demo and a free trial on their website at [HelloBonsai.com](https://www.hellobonsai.com).

In short, Bonsai is like your business's Swiss Army knife, making it simpler to manage everything from client introductions to invoicing. You can spend less time on admin tasks and more time doing what you love while feeling supported by a tool that understands the unique challenges of being self-employed.
